doc.field: Series XXIII: Pride and Progress / The Right Stuff
Series XXIII: Pride and Progress / The Right Stuff
[1]--Pride and Progress, Episode No. 13 [2]--The Right Stuff, Episode No. 189[Air Date: 3/26/1986]
[1]--Pride and Progress, Episode No. 13 [2]--The Right Stuff, Episode No. 189[Air Date: 3/26/1986]

Pride and ProgressNews-highlights:1. National Security Agency agrees to a reinstate gay and bisexual men in agency2. Minneapolis, health club owner faces daily three hundred dollar fine for unfair hiring policies, only hires fundamentalist Christians3. Baltimore, Maryland gay activists band together for gay civil rights, Anti Discrimination Fund4. Moral majority leader Jerry Falwell responds to phone harassment with new number5. Andy Humm speaks in City Hall Rally, March 18th, 1986, coverage and interviewCOMMERCIAL: CASIO Pocket TV6. Minnesotan gay Air Force Pilot takes military to court for his discharge7. Gay teachers fight homophobia in Idaho8. Brown University sponsors conference for five hundred northeastern college students, conference focuses on efficient ways to run gay campus groups and community outreachCOMMERCIAL: SF AIDS Foundation9. Minneapolis, Minnesota government pledges job security to any citizen with AIDS10. Venereal warts10. National Jewish AIDS Project11. National AIDS Network starts in Washington, D.C.COMMERCIAL: "New York Native" with Quentin Crisp12. Sports, Bill Baumer interviews Gay Pool League13. Healthline: Conversations with GMHC: Sara Mercado, loses son to AIDS, discusses AIDS care and her experiences14. Closing credits
The Right Stuff:1. This Week in Gay History with Jeff BixbyCOMMERCIAL: Commodore Plus 42. Julie Curtis coverage of "Don't Tell Mamma"COMMERCIAL: SF AIDS Foundation3. GCN Book Review: Quentin Crisp's Manners From Heaven and How to Become a Virgin4. Sybil Bruncheon with Joseph VianeCOMMERCIAL: The Monster5. Sybil and Joseph return, cuts off
[1]--Pride and Progress, Episode No. 13 [2]--The Right Stuff, Episode No. 189[Air Date: 3/26/1986]: March 1986
